lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The statement said one measure meant that residents in Spain would now be able to borrow up to the equivalent of 1.5 billion pesetas from abroad, providing that the average length of the loans was at least one year, that the borrower was not a Spanish branch of a non-resident lending agent, and that the loan was denominated in a currency traded in Spain, in convertible pesetas or in European Currency Units (ECUS).

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The existing limit on foreign obligations of three times the value of capital and reserves of a borrower bank is abolished, although the Bank of Spain will continue to monitor the banks' obligations.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The latest measures follow recent moves to abolish the maximum interest rates banks can offer for some peseta funds and the lifting of restrictions on investments abroad by Spaniards.
